intro: Farsetia tenuisiliqua, commonly known as the slender leaf farsetia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
